topic.title: Import/Export
topic.p:
Use this window to import and/or to export your address book information to or from your server. Import / Export is one of four windows located in the Address Book provided by the Control Panel, as follows:
Addresses
Add Contact
Add List
Import / Export
This feature supports two common formats:

ul.li: CSV (comma-separated values) file format supported by spreadsheet programs such as Microsoft Excel, Open Office Calc, and Gnome Gnumeric.

V-Card (also known as Versitcard or vCard) electronic business card format supported by organizations such as Apple, AT&T, IBM, and Lucent Technologies for the purpose of personal data interchange by means of Internet email and/or the World Wide Web.

ol.title: To navigate to the Import/Export window:

li.p: In the Address Book menu group, click Import/Export (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).

ol.title: To import an Address Book:
ol.li: Verify that you have access to an address file in one of the following formats: CSV (comma delimited) or VCF (V-Card).
Locate the file to import by typing the path to that file or click Browse to locate the file.
Specify the correct file format (Comma Delimited [CSV] or V-Card [VCF]).
Click Import. A message appears indicating the contacts were imported successfully.
As needed, use the features of your Control Panel's Address Book window to verify the content of the import to your server and/or to configure the address book.

ol.title: To export an Address Book:
ol.li: Specify the correct file format (Comma Delimited [CSV] or V-Card [VCF]). A message appears indicating the address book is exported successfully.
Click Export. Depending on how your local system and your browser are configured, a message asking you to open the file or save it to disk.
Use the features of your browser to save or open the file. The default name of the file is addressbook_export.csv or addressbook_export.vcf.
As needed, use the features of your email and/or address book program to verify the content of the export, rename the file, and/or configure the address book.
